description: Inherited from late Middle English combataunt, from Middle French combatant. Doublet of combattant.

adjectives.description: combatant (comparative more combatant, superlative most combatant)

examples: Their valours are not yet so combatant,
Or truly antagonistick, as to fight;
He wished he were in a combatant service; he wanted to fight, fight.

entries.meaning: A person engaged in combat, often armed.
examples: Gladiators were combatants who fought to the death to entertain the public.
